issue.title: [C++] Plasma JNI component links to flatbuffers::flatbuffers (unnecessarily?)
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6799](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6799). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Does not appear to be tested in CI. Originally reported at https://github.com/apache/arrow/issues/5575

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6799?focusedCommentId=16951627) by Micah Kornfield (emkornfield@gmail.com):*
As part of this we should make sure we have this component running in CI

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6799?focusedCommentId=17007834) by Jacques Nadeau (jnadeau):*
Should we just delete the plasma jni implementation? It seems like it was never finished and no one is maintaining it?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6799?focusedCommentId=17010196) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
If it's not being maintained then I agree we should delete it

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6799?focusedCommentId=17011041) by Micah Kornfield (emkornfield@gmail.com):*
What criteria are we using for "maintained"?  There might be some other code that would fall into this category (ORC JNI support comes to mind).

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6799?focusedCommentId=17012146) by Jacques Nadeau (jnadeau):*
I just opened ARROW-7534 to create a contrib module and demote these things to their. I think that if we don't have development or user engagement on a contrib module for two quarters (or something like that), it should probably be thought of as "no longer used/maintained".

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6799?focusedCommentId=17116210) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
This is no longer an issue because Flatbuffers is not in our toolchain anymore
